column2: the husband and wife walked all the way home in silence. The tax-collector walked behind his wife
column6: he recalled the look of beatitude which had so irritated him at the club
column7: and the consciousness that the beatitude was gone filled his soul with triumph. He was pleased and satisfied
column8: and at the same time he felt the lack of something; he would have liked to go back to the club and make every one feel dreary and miserable
column9: so that all might know how stale and worthless life is when you walk along the streets in the dark and hear the slush of the mud under your feet
column10: and when you know that you will wake up next morning with nothing to look forward to but vodka and cards. Oh
column11: how awful it is!And Anna Pavlovna could scarcely walk.... She was still under the influence of the dancing
column15: and the noise; she asked herself as she walked along why God had thus afflicted her.
